Submodules¶

qiskit_aqua.algorithms.quantum_algorithm module¶

This module implements the abstract base class for algorithm modules.

To create add-on algorithm modules subclass the QuantumAlgorithm class in this module. Doing so requires that the required algorithm interface is implemented.

class qiskit_aqua.algorithms.quantum_algorithm.QuantumAlgorithm[source]¶

class qiskit_aqua.algorithms.VQE(operator, var_form, optimizer, operator_mode='matrix', initial_point=None, batch_mode=False, aux_operators=None)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.algorithms.quantum_algorithm.QuantumAlgorithm

The Variational Quantum Eigensolver algorithm.

See https://arxiv.org/abs/1304.3061

CONFIGURATION = {'defaults': {'optimizer': {'name': 'L_BFGS_B'}, 'variational_form': {'name': 'RYRZ'}, 'initial_state': {'name': 'ZERO'}}, 'depends': ['optimizer', 'variational_form', 'initial_state'], 'description': 'VQE Algorithm', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'vqe_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'operator_mode': {'type': 'string', 'default': 'matrix', 'oneOf': [{'enum': ['matrix', 'paulis', 'grouped_paulis']}]}, 'initial_point': {'type': ['array', 'null'], 'items': {'type': 'number'}, 'default': None}, 'batch_mode': {'type': 'boolean', 'default': False}}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'VQE', 'problems': ['energy', 'ising']}¶
SECTION_KEY_ALGORITHM = 'algorithm'¶
SECTION_KEY_FEATURE_MAP = 'feature_map'¶
SECTION_KEY_INITIAL_STATE = 'initial_state'¶
SECTION_KEY_IQFT = 'iqft'¶
SECTION_KEY_MULTICLASS_EXTENSION = 'multiclass_extension'¶
SECTION_KEY_OPTIMIZER = 'optimizer'¶
SECTION_KEY_ORACLE = 'oracle'¶
SECTION_KEY_UNCERTAINTY_MODEL = 'uncertainty_model'¶
SECTION_KEY_UNCERTAINTY_PROBLEM = 'uncertainty_problem'¶
SECTION_KEY_VAR_FORM = 'variational_form'¶
__init__(operator, var_form, optimizer, operator_mode='matrix', initial_point=None, batch_mode=False, aux_operators=None)[source]¶

Constructor.

Parameters:
  • operator (Operator) – Qubit operator
  • operator_mode (str) – operator mode, used for eval of operator
  • var_form (VariationalForm) – parametrized variational form.
  • optimizer (Optimizer) – the classical optimization algorithm.
  • initial_point (numpy.ndarray) – optimizer initial point.
  • aux_operators ([Operator]) – Auxiliary operators to be evaluated at each eigenvalue

class qiskit_aqua.algorithms.QAOA(operator, optimizer, p=1, operator_mode='matrix', initial_point=None, batch_mode=False, aux_operators=None)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.algorithms.adaptive.vqe.vqe.VQE

The Quantum Approximate Optimization Algorithm.

See https://arxiv.org/abs/1411.4028

CONFIGURATION = {'defaults': {'optimizer': {'name': 'COBYLA'}}, 'depends': ['optimizer'], 'description': 'Quantum Approximate Optimization Algorithm', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'qaoa_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'operator_mode': {'type': 'string', 'default': 'matrix', 'oneOf': [{'enum': ['matrix', 'paulis', 'grouped_paulis']}]}, 'p': {'type': 'integer', 'default': 1, 'minimum': 1}, 'initial_point': {'type': ['array', 'null'], 'items': {'type': 'number'}, 'default': None}, 'batch_mode': {'type': 'boolean', 'default': False}}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'QAOA.Variational', 'problems': ['ising']}¶

Parameters:
  • operator (Operator) – Qubit operator
  • operator_mode (str) – operator mode, used for eval of operator
  • p (int) – the integer parameter p as specified in https://arxiv.org/abs/1411.4028
  • optimizer (Optimizer) – the classical optimization algorithm.
  • initial_point (str) – optimizer initial point.

__init__(optimizer, feature_map, var_form, training_dataset, test_dataset=None, datapoints=None, batch_mode=False)[source]¶

Initialize the object :param training_dataset: {‘A’: numpy.ndarray, ‘B’: numpy.ndarray, …} :type training_dataset: dict :param test_dataset: the same format as training_dataset :type test_dataset: dict :param datapoints: NxD array, N is the number of data and D is data dimension :type datapoints: numpy.ndarray :param optimizer: Optimizer instance :type optimizer: Optimizer :param feature_map: FeatureMap instance :type feature_map: FeatureMap :param var_form: VariationalForm instance :type var_form: VariationalForm :param batch_mode: Batch mode for circuit compilation and execution :type batch_mode: boolean

Notes

We used label denotes numeric results and class means the name of that class (str).

label_to_class¶
load_model(file_path)[source]¶
predict(data, quantum_instance=None)[source]¶

Predict the labels for the data.

Parameters:
  • data (numpy.ndarray) – NxD array, N is number of data, D is data dimension
  • quantum_instance (QuantumInstance) – quantum backend with all setting
Returns:

for each data point, generates the predicted probability for each class list: for each data point, generates the predicted label, which with the highest prob
Return type:

[dict]

class qiskit_aqua.algorithms.SVM_Classical(training_dataset, test_dataset=None, datapoints=None, gamma=None, multiclass_extension=None)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.algorithms.quantum_algorithm.QuantumAlgorithm

The classical svm interface. Internally, it will run the binary classification or multiclass classification based on how many classes the data have.

class qiskit_aqua.algorithms.QSVMKernel(feature_map, training_dataset, test_dataset=None, datapoints=None, multiclass_extension=None)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.algorithms.quantum_algorithm.QuantumAlgorithm

Quantum SVM kernel method.

Internally, it will run the binary classification or multiclass classification based on how many classes the data have.

CONFIGURATION = {'defaults': {'feature_map': {'name': 'SecondOrderExpansion', 'depth': 2}}, 'depends': ['multiclass_extension', 'feature_map'], 'description': 'QSVMKernel Algorithm', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'QSVM_Kernel_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'QSVM.Kernel', 'problems': ['svm_classification']}¶
SECTION_KEY_ALGORITHM = 'algorithm'¶
SECTION_KEY_FEATURE_MAP = 'feature_map'¶
SECTION_KEY_INITIAL_STATE = 'initial_state'¶

__init__(feature_map, training_dataset, test_dataset=None, datapoints=None, multiclass_extension=None)[source]¶

Constructor.

Parameters:
  • feature_map (FeatureMap) – feature map module, used to transform data
  • training_dataset (dict) – training dataset.
  • test_dataset (dict) – testing dataset.
  • datapoints (numpy.ndarray) – prediction dataset.
  • multiclass_extension (MultiExtension) – if number of classes > 2, a multiclass scheme is is needed.
Raises:
  • ValueError – if training_dataset is None
  • AquaError – use binary classifer for classes > 3

class qiskit_aqua.algorithms.QPE(operator, state_in, iqft, num_time_slices=1, num_ancillae=1, paulis_grouping='random', expansion_mode='trotter', expansion_order=1, shallow_circuit_concat=False)[source]¶

The Quantum Phase Estimation algorithm.

__init__(operator, state_in, iqft, num_time_slices=1, num_ancillae=1, paulis_grouping='random', expansion_mode='trotter', expansion_order=1, shallow_circuit_concat=False)[source]¶

Constructor.

Parameters:
  • operator (Operator) – the hamiltonian Operator object
  • state_in (InitialState) – the InitialState pluggable component representing the initial quantum state
  • iqft (IQFT) – the Inverse Quantum Fourier Transform pluggable component
  • num_time_slices (int) – the number of time slices
  • num_ancillae (int) – the number of ancillary qubits to use for the measurement
  • paulis_grouping (str) – the pauli term grouping mode
  • expansion_mode (str) – the expansion mode (trotter|suzuki)
  • expansion_order (int) – the suzuki expansion order
  • shallow_circuit_concat (bool) – indicate whether to use shallow (cheap) mode for circuit concatenation

class qiskit_aqua.algorithms.AmplitudeEstimation(num_eval_qubits, a_factory, q_factory=None, iqft=None)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.algorithms.quantum_algorithm.QuantumAlgorithm

The Amplitude Estimation algorithm.

CONFIGURATION = {'defaults': {'uncertainty_model': {'name': 'NormalDistribution'}, 'iqft': {'name': 'STANDARD'}}, 'depends': ['uncertainty_problem', 'uncertainty_model', 'iqft'], 'description': 'Amplitude Estimation Algorithm', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'AmplitudeEstimation_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'num_eval_qubits': {'type': 'integer', 'default': 5, 'minimum': 1}}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'AmplitudeEstimation', 'problems': ['uncertainty']}¶
SECTION_KEY_ALGORITHM = 'algorithm'¶
SECTION_KEY_FEATURE_MAP = 'feature_map'¶
SECTION_KEY_INITIAL_STATE = 'initial_state'¶
SECTION_KEY_IQFT = 'iqft'¶
SECTION_KEY_MULTICLASS_EXTENSION = 'multiclass_extension'¶
SECTION_KEY_OPTIMIZER = 'optimizer'¶
SECTION_KEY_ORACLE = 'oracle'¶
SECTION_KEY_UNCERTAINTY_MODEL = 'uncertainty_model'¶
SECTION_KEY_UNCERTAINTY_PROBLEM = 'uncertainty_problem'¶
SECTION_KEY_VAR_FORM = 'variational_form'¶
__init__(num_eval_qubits, a_factory, q_factory=None, iqft=None)[source]¶

Constructor.

Parameters:
  • num_eval_qubits (int) – number of evaluation qubits
  • a_factory (CircuitFactory) – the CircuitFactory subclass object representing the problem unitary
  • q_factory (CircuitFactory) – the CircuitFactory subclass object representing an amplitude estimation sample (based on a_factory)
  • iqft (IQFT) – the Inverse Quantum Fourier Transform pluggable component, defaults to using a standard iqft when None
